definitions: to leave someone or something behind; to desert
examples: They had to abandon the car.

definitions: possession of the means or skill to do something
examples: She has the ability to solve complex problems.

definitions: in or to a foreign country
examples: He studied abroad for two years.

definitions: to take in or soak up (energy, liquid, or another substance)
to take in information, ideas, or experience
examples: I couldn't absorb all the details.

definitions: existing in thought or as an idea but not having a physical or concrete existence
examples: Abstract concepts can be hard to grasp.
